title: Is Shakespeare considered a universal writer? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes, a large sum of the themes, ideas and characters present in his work are placed within every society in all time periods. For example, the Montagues and Capulets dispute depicts the idiocy of many wars and conflicts within human history, the reluctance to forgive and consider the human aspect of situations and the dangers of excessive pride both within both cultures and individuals.
